definition[0]: to make someone feel unhappy and tired
example[0]: His lack of social life was beginning to get him down.
definition[1]: to write something, especially something that someone is saying
example[1]: He was followed by a group of reporters trying to get down every word he said.
example[2]: It’s important to get things down on paper.
definition[2]: to eat or drink something, or persuade someone else to eat or drink something
example[3]: I knew I’d feel better once I’d got some food down.
example[5]: He still says he’s not hungry, and I can’t get anything down him.
definition[3]: to leave the table after a meal – used by children or when you are talking to children
